text:
Currently if you put this line in your build.xml file
  <taskdef name="mytask" classname="com.mydomain.MyVeryOwnTask"/>
you will get this message:
  BUILD FAILED
  build.xml:10: taskdef class com.mydomain.MyVeryOwnTask cannot be found

It would be nice if you could put a line like this in your build file
  <taskdef name="mytask" classname="com.mydomain.MyVeryOwnTask"
  help="Please go to http://mydomain.com/MyVeryOwnTask.html to download."\>
so that you would get this message:
  BUILD FAILED
  build.xml:10: taskdef class com.mydomain.MyVeryOwnTask cannot be found
  Please go to http://mydomain.com/MyVeryOwnTask.html to download.

This would allow somebody to take your build file and get builds up and running
much more quickly.
creator: 1010apache.org@ostermiller.com
mbenson@apache.org
text:
In Ant 1.7 you will be able to work around this by setting onerror to "report"
or "ignore", then using the typedef condition to determine whether the type was
found.

Additionally, the diagnostics have been much improved for Ant 1.7, so while the 
taskdef won't tell a user where to download something, they should end much 
more clueful than they would be in current Ant versions.
creator: mbenson@apache.org
